intro: Dorstenia cayapia f. paraguariensis, commonly known as the Paraguayan mountain star, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its unique, star-shaped inflorescences and hairy, fleshy leaves. Native to the Andean regions of South America, this plant thrives in high-altitude, humid environments. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display. Its growth habit includes a creeping stem with erect flowering shoots, making it a distinctive addition to botanical gardens.
